intro: Cordia santacruzensis, commonly known as the Santa Cruz cordia, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
